sen.j: 俵屋 宗達（たわらや そうたつ、生没年不詳 - 慶長から寛永年間に活動）は、江戸時代初期の画家。
sen.e: Sotatsu TAWARAYA (date of birth and death unknown, active between 1596 and 1644) was a painter during the early Edo Period.
Sotatsu TAWARAYA (date of birth and death unknown, active between 1596 and 1644) was a painter during the early Edo Period.
Sotatsu TAWARAYA (date of birth and death unknown, active between 1596 and 1644) was a painter during the early Edo Period.

sen.j: 通称は野々村宗達。
sen.e: He was commonly called Sotatsu NONOMURA.
He was commonly called Sotatsu NONOMURA.
He was commonly called Sotatsu NONOMURA.

sen.j: 号は「伊年」あるいは「対青軒」ほか。
sen.e: His pseudonym was Inen, Taiseiken and there were others.
Among his pseudonyms he was called Inen, Taiseiken and others.
Among his pseudonyms he was called Inen, Taiseiken and others.

sen.j: 宗達は尾形光琳と並び称せられる、近世初期の大画家である。
sen.e: Sotatsu was a great early modern period painter, ranked with Korin OGATA; and in spite of his name recognition and huge influence he left on his successors, much about his life history is unclear and his date of birth and death are still unknown.

Sotatsu was a great early modern period painter, ranked with Korin OGATA. Despite his name recognition and the huge influence he left on his successors, much about his life history is unclear and his date of birth and death are still unknown.
Sotatsu was a great early modern period painter, ranked with Korin OGATA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処原文を。で終わるように修正。OK

sen.j: しかし、その知名度の高さと後世への影響の大きさに比べ、その伝記には不明な点が多く、生没年さえわかっていない。
sen.e: Despite his name recognition and the huge influence he left on his successors, much about his life history is unclear and his date of birth and death are still unknown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処原文を若干修正。OK

sen.j: 京都で「俵屋」という絵画工房を率い、主に扇絵を制作していたらしい。
sen.e: It seems he had an atelier called "Tawaraya" where he mainly painted pictures on folding fans.
It seems he had a studio called Tawaraya where he mainly painted pictures on folding fans.
It seems he had a studio called Tawaraya where he mainly painted pictures on folding fans.

sen.j: しかし、宗達は単なる扇絵職人ではなく、当時の皇室から作画の依頼があった。
sen.e: Sotatsu was not just a fan painter, but so well known for his painting that the Imperial family requested his work.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sotatsu was not just a fan painter, but also well known for his painting--so much so that the Imperial family requested his work.
Sotatsu was not just a fan painter, but also well known for his painting--so much so that the Imperial family requested his work.

sen.j: また、当代一流の文化人であった烏丸光広や本阿弥光悦らの書巻に下絵を描いていたらしい。
sen.e: He also painted pictures on the books written by top-ranking cultural figures of the time such as Mitsuhiro KARASUMARU and Koetsu HONAMI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He also painted pictures on the books written by top-ranking cultural figures of the time such as Mitsuhiro KARASUMARU and Koetsu HONAMI.
He also painted pictures on the books written by top-ranking cultural figures of the time such as Mitsuhiro KARASUMARU and Koetsu HONAMI.

sen.j: また、少なくとも寛永7年（1630年）には町の絵師としては異例の法橋の位が与えられていたことがわかっており、当時から一流の絵師とみなされていたことは疑いない。
sen.e: There is no doubt that he was considered one of the top painters of the period from that fact he was given the rank of Hokyo (rank or title originally given to men and women in the Buddhist order, which was later also granted to artists) in 1630, which, at the time, was extremely rare.

There is no doubt that he was considered one of the top painters of the period--from that fact he was given the rank of Hokyo (rank or title originally given to men and women in the Buddhist order, which was later also granted to artists) in 1630, which, at the time, was extremely rare.

There is no doubt that he was considered one of the top painters of the period--from that fact he was given the rank of Hokyo (rank or title originally given to men and women in the Buddhist order, which was later also granted to artists) in 1630, which, at the time, was extremely rare.

sen.j: その他、慶長7年（1602年）5月に行われた平家納経の修復に関わったと見られている。
sen.e: He is thought to have been involved in the Heike-nokyo, Sutras Dedication by the Taira Family, which was held in May of 1602.
He is thought to have been involved in the Heike-nokyo, Sutras Dedication by the Taira Family, which was held in May of 1602.
He is thought to have been involved in the Heike-nokyo, Sutras Dedication by the Taira Family, which was held in May of 1602.

sen.j: 光琳が私淑し、琳派の祖と言われるが、江戸時代後期から明治時代にかけては評価が低く、光琳の画の方が上だとみなされていた。
sen.e: Sotatsu is considered to be an artist who was modeled by Korin and the founder of the Rin school of art; however, the general opinion of his work was not high through to the Meiji Period (to July 1912), with Korin's paintings being considered to be of a higher grade.

Sotatsu is considered to be an artist who was modeled by Korin and the founder of the Rin school of art; however, there was not a high general opinion of his work through to the Meiji Period (to July 1912), with Korin's paintings being considered to be of a higher grade.

Sotatsu is considered to be an artist who was modeled by Korin and the founder of the Rin school of art; however, there was not a high general opinion of his work through to the Meiji Period (to July 1912), with Korin's paintings being considered to be of a higher grade.

sen.j: そのため、明治期に代表作の松島図屏風を始め、多くの作品が海外に流出した。
sen.e: For this reason, many of his works, including his famous "Matsushima-zu Byobu" (a folding screen: Waves at Matsushima) were exported overseas.
For this reason, many of his works, including his famous Matsushima-zu Byobu (a folding screen: Waves at Matsushima) were exported overseas.
For this reason, many of his works, including his famous Matsushima-zu Byobu (a folding screen: Waves at Matsushima) were exported overseas.

sen.j: 大正時代に評価が見直され、現在では光琳以上に評価が高い。
sen.e: During the Taisho Period (July 30, 1912-December 25, 1926) his works were reexamined and currently his works are considered to be superior to Korin's.
During the Taisho Period (July 30, 1912-December 25, 1926) his works were reexamined and currently his works are considered to be superior to Korin's.
During the Taisho Period (July 30, 1912-December 25, 1926) his works were reexamined and currently his works are considered to be superior to Korin's.

sen.j: 風神雷神図ほか3点が国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: His "Fujin Raijin-zu" (Wind God and Thunder God Screens) and three other works are designated as National Treasures.
His Fujin Raijin-zu (Wind God and Thunder God Screens) and three other works are designated as National Treasures.
His Fujin Raijin-zu (Wind God and Thunder God Screens) and three other works are designated as National Treasures.

sen.j: 著名な「風神雷神図」のような装飾的大画面のほか、水墨画の作例もある。
sen.e: Other than his famous huge decorative screen painting "Wind God and Thunder God," there are some works in water ink.
Other than his famous huge decorative screen painting Wind God and Thunder God, he has some works in water ink.
Other than his famous huge decorative screen painting Wind God and Thunder God, he has some works in water ink.

sen.j: 水墨の名作「蓮池水禽（れんちすいきん）図」は、生乾きの水墨にさらに濃淡の異なる墨を含ませて「にじみ」による偶然の効果を狙った、いわゆる「たらしこみ」の技法が用いられている。
sen.e: Sotatsu's famous water ink work "Renchi Suikin-zu" (Waterfowl in Lotus Pond) was drawn using the Tarashikomi technique, a technique that achieves shading through the pooling of successive layers of partially dried pigment for a coincidental effect.

Sotatsu's famous water ink work Renchi Suikin-zu (Waterfowl in Lotus Pond) was drawn using the Tarashikomi technique--a technique that achieves shading through the pooling of successive layers of partially dried pigment for a coincidental effect.

Sotatsu's famous water ink work Renchi Suikin-zu (Waterfowl in Lotus Pond) was drawn using the Tarashikomi technique--a technique that achieves shading through the pooling of successive layers of partially dried pigment for a coincidental effect.

sen.j: 風神雷神図 - 建仁寺（京都国立博物館委託）
sen.e: "Fujin Raijin-zu" (Wind God and Thunder God Screens) - Kennin-ji Temple (Entrusted to Kyoto National Museum)
Fujin Raijin-zu (Wind God and Thunder God Screens) - Kennin-ji Temple (Entrusted to Kyoto National Museum)
